description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dgf1","text":"Protocol for the identification of a plasmid by polymerase chain reaction followed by gel electrophoresis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"5lrut","text":"Target DNA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bs5ib","text":"PCR master mix","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93op1","text":"Forward primer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"es9of","text":"Reverse primer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3g4gg","text":"Sterile water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f6uuh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ro18","text":"Materials available: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"as3le","text":"• Primers amp-F and amp-R, kan-F and kan-R.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bobm7","text":"• A commercially available PCR Master Mix at 2X concentration (containing Taq polymerase  buffer, 1.5 mM MgCl2, 0.2 mM each of dATP, dCTP, dGTP and dTTP, Taq polymerase, and  a red dye to allow direct loading of the completed reaction onto an agarose gel) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5buec","text":"• Plasmids at 100 ng.µl-1 ; you will need to dilute this DNA to a working concentration of 0.1  ng.µl-1 before you use them","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9lhde","text":"Add   of the target DNA, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ush1","text":"  of each primer, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"brlte","text":"  of 2X PCR master mix, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8s7nc","text":"and sufficient sterile water to make the volume up to  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":54,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3mv4l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"1DE4CE10B5AC11ED97C9D9CDC55CA4ED","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":8}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"2128D580B5AC11ED97C9D9CDC55CA4ED","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"2328C430B5AC11ED97C9D9CDC55CA4ED","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"2648C8E0B5AC11ED97C9D9CDC55CA4ED","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2oeim","text":"Thermocycle on the following settings:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e14ck","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a60od","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"96ldi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["number of cycles","temperature, C","time, minutes"],"colWidths":["129","115",100],"data":[["1 cycle","94","1"],["30 cycles","94","1"],["30 cycles","55","1"],["30 cycles","72","1"],["1 cycle","72","5"]],"guid":"6FFC6E10B5AC11ED97C9D9CDC55CA4ED","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"82bi","text":"cycle programme for PCR","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["1 cycle","94","1"],["30 cycles","94","1"],["30 cycles","55","1"],["30 cycles","72","1"],["1 cycle","72","5"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"foes9","text":"Add   1× TAE buffer and swirl gently to mix. Put an inverted small conical flask in the top of the flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"19cr4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"21276E90B5AF11ED97C9D9CDC55CA4ED","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cloj1","text":"Place in a microwave and heat for 1 minute, then gently swirl the contents. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ahqnm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5bu7b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e2iqb","text":"Remember to wear heatproof gloves and swirl the contents very carefully, as the liquid can become superheated.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"g5vo","text":"Continue microwaving in 30-second blasts followed by gentle swirling until the agarose starts to boil. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"akm02","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l1v4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5qptg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e30fr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b2n9a","text":"At this point you need to handle the flask very carefully.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aut4d","text":"Continue microwaving in 15-second blasts until all the agarose has dissolved - you should not be able to see any tiny pieces floating in the gel suspension.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d4oeh","text":"Place the flask in a   water bath to cool. It is important to make sure the agarose has cooled to   before proceeding to the next stage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":98,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"m15o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"16A06CB0B5AF11ED97C9D9CDC55CA4ED","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"50","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"19860070B5AF11ED97C9D9CDC55CA4ED","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"50","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f1acj","text":"Whilst you are waiting for the gel to cool, prepare your gel tray by securely taping up the ends.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ah6u1","text":"Once the agarose has cooled (5-10 minutes should be OK), add   of   to the cooled gel mixture and swirl to mix. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":61,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":66,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"uo41","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ds03f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53far","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"FA28D3B0B5AE11ED97C9D9CDC55CA4ED","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"022D9780B5AF11ED97C9D9CDC55CA4ED","id":124808,"linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Midori Green direct","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"MG06","stats":{"total_protocols":1},"url":"","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/1.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.protocols.io","name":"Contributed by users"}}},"2":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f49nl","text":"Wear gloves to handle Midori Green and the resulting gel.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eu7qj","text":"Pour the molten agarose into the gel tray and insert the comb (make sure it is straight and level) and leave to set.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6oeai","text":"Weigh out the correct amount of agarose and place it in a   conical flask. Note: for a 1% gel you will need   of agarose for every   of buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":58,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":108,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":131,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8k5vp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"250","error":false,"guid":"388073C0B5AF11ED97C9D9CDC55CA4ED","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"3B850130B5AF11ED97C9D9CDC55CA4ED","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"3D5888B0B5AF11ED97C9D9CDC55CA4ED","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3nh30","text":"Add TAE buffer to the tank, then add the gel and ensure it is fully submerged in TAE. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efacc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"m3ah","text":"Load the DNA samples into the gel, and add a DNA ladder to one of the wells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8dut8","text":"Observe the gel and locations of the DNA fragments","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
